title: Ticket #5204: Make processing of periodic exprs in schedd more efficient
description:
The handling of Periodic expression evaluations in the SCHEDD can use a significant amount of time. It can be 5 seconds or so each time the queue is walked to check expressions even if all most of the expressions are trivial and false and none of them fire.

This slowness is because the code that actually does the evaluation isn't careful about how many attributes are fetched for each job. Because trivial Expr=false expressions are inserted into the job ad and thus cannot be quickly skipped, and because the system periodic expressions are repeatedly param'd and parsed.

two of these things can be easily fixed, and should help the CERN schedd deal with 100's of thousands of jobs.
